sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Slowly but steadily, the forensic team in the newly liberated town of Izium are identifying more and more bodies in mass graves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In this pine forest on the edge of the city, the stench of death fills the air.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There are an estimated 430 graves here, but there could be more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Exhumation work continues today, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says. Examinations of the bodies are being conducted. More than 10 torture chambers have already been found in various cities and towns liberated in Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The EU presidency held this semester by the Czech Republic has raised the possibility of establishing a special court to try alleged war crimes committed in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Following the recapture of Izum, all eyes are now on Kupyansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The town was captured without a fight just three days into the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: captured without a fight just three days into the war. Various sources claim Kyiv has already taken back the city, but on the ground there is more caution. It's still too early to talk about the full liberation of Kupyansk, this volunteer says. That side was allegedly cleared, but our soldiers withdrew from there, because as as I understand to keep that side we need heavy military equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As the Ukrainian advance continues the Russians are striking back. Artillery attacks have reportedly killed two people in the Kharkiv and Donetsk region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russian appointed authorities say four have been killed in what they say was a Ukrainian strike in central Donetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has touched down in Armenia, days after border clashes with Azerbaijan has jeopardized Western efforts to broker lasting peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Clashes this week were the worst seen since the 2020 war, killing more than 200 people before hostilities ended on Thursday after international mediation. Many see the cooperation with the West as an alternative to the collective security treaty organization, which they believe has not been helpful in their conflict with Azerbaijan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have very big dissatisfaction with the CSTO organization, which cannot help Armenia at all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It does not work in the interests of its member country, and it supports the regime of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and Armenia's president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So it seems to me that we do not need such an organization, and that we immediately need to withdraw from such an organization and that we immediately need to withdraw from such an organization for the sake of the interests of the country its sovereignty and national security Pelosi says the trip is intended to highlight the United States's firm commitment to a peaceful Armenia she is the highest-ranking US official to travel there since its 1991 independence from the Soviet Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The eight grandchildren of Queen Elizabeth II, led by Prince William and his brother Harry, stood in silence for a 15-minute vigil surrounding the remains of the former monarch lying in state in the historic Westminster Hall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: William, who was now the heir to the throne, stood at the head of the flag-draped coffin as mourners filed quietly past. Some bowed and made the sign of the cross. Outside King Charles III and his son the Prince of Wales made an unannounced visit to a long row of people. They shook hands and greeted well-wishers in the kilometres long queue near London's Lambeth Bridge. The line accessing the interior of the burning chapel exceeds 24 hours of waiting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Earlier on Saturday, authorities warned it was about to reach capacity, while London police say Monday's funeral will be the biggest security operation it has ever undertaken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In their droves, they come, wanting to say a final farewell to the Queen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But for local hospitality businesses, it's provided a much-needed mini-boom. Hotels and bars are now packed. One example is the Riverside Cafe, which is just in front of the queue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Very busy. I mean, since the last two days, we've been extremely busy. We usually open at 9, but for the last four days we managed to open from seven.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We were busy like this when the Queen Man passed away in 2002, but it wasn't as busy as it is nowadays, I mean, this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Many other businesses feel the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They are very thankful after years of tough times during the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: After the state funeral on Monday, many of the hotels may be less busy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And it's the way the market responds in relation to the laws of supply and demand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But speaking to a hospitality sector, not just hotels, but restaurants, bars and pubs, they've had an awful three years because of this pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On Monday, the country will focus on saying goodbye to the Queen, many living their whole lives under her reign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One of the biggest typhoons ever to strike Japan has made landfall on the southern island of Kyushu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At least four million people have been told to evacuate their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Typhoon Namadol landed near the city of Kagoshima. Authorities had issued a special alert for the island, warning the biggest threat to life and property is from the rain, which is already causing rivers to rise and could unleash land and mudslides. Bullet trains, ferries and hundreds of flights have been cancelled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The typhoon is expected to travel up through central Japan over the coming days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: and Puerto Rico, where hurricane warnings are in place. On Friday, it went across Guadalupe, killing a man who was swept away with his house when a nearby river flooded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Its residents were prepared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This woman says, We buy groceries and we stay locked in our homes, except for extreme cases when we might call the emergency services. Schools in Guadeloupe were closed as the island experienced 120 kilometers an hour winds and 23 centimeters of rain in three hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some residents stocked up on essentials.

sentences.sentence: I'm getting some water in case we're cut off, and candles, you never know.

sentences.sentence: cut off and candles you never know. But the storm is not that big. So far this cyclonic season, seven named storms have formed in the Atlantic basin, two of which, Danielle and Earl, have reached hurricane status.

sentences.sentence: The death toll from the floods in central Italy's Marche region has risen to 11 and according to local authorities there are still two people missing a child and a woman in the small town of Pianelli di Ostra three people perished one inhabitant lost her husband and her 25 year old son who had just graduated as a mechanical engineer it's all over for me I don't know how I'll live without my son and my husband, she says.

sentences.sentence: While the search continues, the clean-up is well underway, but bad weather continues to cause problems in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Dozens of Benin bronze sculptures are going on display one last time in Berlin's new Humboldt Museum before being repatriated to Nigeria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Stolen during the colonial era from the African Kingdom of Benin, the move is part of the country's gradual reckoning with crimes committed by the former German Empire, including the genocide orchestrated by Germany in Namibia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This object represented our ancestors, our fathers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So now that it's going to be brought back to the kingdom, it's going to fill the vacuums that were left for thousands of years backwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While this exhibition has been described as the country's most important cultural project, Germany has faced criticism in recent years over the origin of many artifacts in its museums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The general director of the Humboldt Forum says, origin of many artefacts in its museums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The General Director of the Humboldt Forum says, we have learned that restitution is much more than an administrative act, but a shared intercultural and at best a productive process of negotiation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And that is about personal preferences, about self-empowerment, about cultural identity and about dignity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And we have learned to listen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: You talk, we listen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Humboldt Forum was opened to the public on Saturday following a ceremony.
